alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; East Central Plains; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Sandia and Manzano Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued October 11 at 2:25PM MDT until October 12 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING WARNING IN EFFECT THURSDAY BETWEEN 11 AM AND 7 PM FOR THE NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS, NORTHEAST PLAINS, EAST CENTRAL PLAINS, SANDIA AND MANZANO MOUNTAINS, CENTRAL HIGHLANDS AND MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... .A Pacific storm system will bring strong westerly winds through northern and central New Mexico that will peak in intensity Thursday afternoon. Low humidity below fifteen percent combined with strong winds gusting to between 45 and 60 mph will be capable of supporting the rapid spread of fire. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 7 PM MDT THURSDAY... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from 11 AM to 7 PM MDT Thursday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Plains (104), Northeast Highlands (123), Sandia and Manzano Mountains (124), Central Highlands (125), and the East Central Plains (126) from 11 AM through 7 PM MDT Thursday. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West to northwest winds strengthening to 25 to 40 mph with gusts of 45 to 60 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from 10 to 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: Central Highlands; East Central Plains; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Sandia and Manzano Mountains
